alert.note: Alert for Wayne; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 10:35AM CDT until March 28 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Illinois... Skillet Fork River at Wayne City. .Flooding continues along the Skillet Fork River at Wayne City. The river is cresting in moderate flood at 17.2 feet, then will begin a rapid fall, dropping below flood stage Monday evening. For the Skillet Fork River...including Wayne City...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skillet Fork River at Wayne City. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest at 17.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
